articles.headline: Mideast Hawks Help to Develop Giuliani Policy
articles.snippet: Rudolph W. Giuliani is consulting with a particularly hawkish group of advisers and neoconservative thinkers.
articles.abstract: Rudolph W. Giuliani is consulting with a particularly hawkish group of advisers and neoconservative thinkers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Rudolph W. Giuliani’s approach to foreign policy shares with other Republican presidential candidates an aggressive posture toward terrorism, a commitment to strengthening the military and disdain for the United Nations.
articles.byline: By Michael Cooper and Marc Santora

articles.headline: A Tax Plan as Trial Run for ’09 Law
articles.snippet: The House’s leading Democratic tax writer will propose a sweeping overhaul of the tax code that would raise taxes on many with incomes above $200,000 but cut taxes for most others.
articles.abstract: The House’s leading Democratic tax writer will propose a sweeping overhaul of the tax code that would raise taxes on many with incomes above $200,000 but cut taxes for most others.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 24  The House’s leading Democratic tax writer will propose a sweeping overhaul of the tax code on Thursday that would increase taxes on many people with incomes above $200,000 but cut them for most others.

articles.headline: Microsoft Buys Stake in Facebook
articles.snippet: The investment ends two months of jockeying among Microsoft, Google and Yahoo for the right to invest in and forge close ties with the fast-growing social networking Web site.
articles.abstract: The investment ends two months of jockeying among Microsoft, Google and Yahoo for the right to invest in and forge close ties with the fast-growing social networking Web site.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 24  Microsoft has won a high-profile technology industry battle with Google and Yahoo to invest in the social networking upstart Facebook.

articles.headline: Merrill Lynch Expected to Quit Downtown for Midtown
articles.snippet: The brokerage’s move would be a blow to downtown and its supporters in Albany, including Gov. Eliot Spitzer, and it would hobble efforts to re-establish ground zero as a financial center.
articles.abstract: The brokerage’s move would be a blow to downtown and its supporters in Albany, including Gov. Eliot Spitzer, and it would hobble efforts to re-establish ground zero as a financial center.
articles.lead_paragraph: Merrill Lynch & Company, the world’s largest brokerage firm, appears ready to move its longtime headquarters from Lower Manhattan to a new skyscraper in Midtown, across Seventh Avenue from Pennsylvania Station, according to government officials and real estate executives.

articles.headline: Apple Offers New Goodies in Leopard System
articles.snippet: Apple’s new version of Leopard lists 300 new features, including a Braille font and a Danish spelling checker.
articles.abstract: Apple’s new version of Leopard lists 300 new features, including a Braille font and a Danish spelling checker.
articles.lead_paragraph: If you’re a computer company, what on earth do you add to the sixth annual version of your operating system?

articles.headline: Firefighters Get Control as Questions Rise
articles.snippet: Inquiries were being made about how the firefight has been coordinated and how resources have been deployed.
articles.abstract: Inquiries were being made about how the firefight has been coordinated and how resources have been deployed.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN DIEGO, Oct. 24 — Firefighters on Wednesday began to assert control over wildfires that have burned through nearly 500,000 acres and displaced half a million residents over four days in Southern California.
articles.byline: By Kirk Johnson and Jennifer Steinhauer

articles.headline: Reports Suggest Broader Losses From Mortgages
articles.snippet: Economists say mortgage market troubles could, all told, cost financial firms and investors up to $400 billion.
articles.abstract: Economists say mortgage market troubles could, all told, cost financial firms and investors up to $400 billion.
articles.lead_paragraph: Every time economists and Wall Street executives think they have acknowledged the full extent of the losses from the meltdown in real estate mortgages, more bad news turns up.
articles.byline: By Vikas Bajaj and Edmund L. Andrews

articles.headline: Under Siege, Blackwater Takes On Air of Bunker
articles.snippet: The secretive world of the Blackwater compound in Baghdad is fraying under intense scrutiny.
articles.abstract: The secretive world of the Blackwater compound in Baghdad is fraying under intense scrutiny.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, Oct. 24 — The Blackwater USA compound here is a fortress within a fortress. Surrounded by a 25-foot-high wall of concrete topped by a chain-link fence and razor wire, the compound sits deep inside the heavily defended Green Zone, its two points of entry guarded by Colombian Army veterans carrying shotguns and automatic rifles.
articles.byline: By Paul von Zielbauer and James Glanz

articles.headline: Merrill’s Chief Is Being Held to Account
articles.snippet: The brokerage’s $7.9 billion write down raised questions about E. Stanley O’Neal’s leadership and the ability of his top executives to manage the risky assets on the firm’s balance sheet.
articles.abstract: The brokerage’s $7.9 billion write down raised questions about E. Stanley O’Neal’s leadership and the ability of his top executives to manage the risky assets on the firm’s balance sheet.
articles.lead_paragraph: In November 2005, Merrill Lynch’s chief executive, E. Stanley O’Neal, told investors that the brokerage firm would shift its strategy and would become more aggressive investing its own money.
articles.byline: By Jenny Anderson and Landon Thomas Jr

articles.headline: Whistle-Blower Finds a Finger Pointing Back
articles.snippet: The government now contends that a whistle-blower within Cell Therapeutics was the mastermind of a much bigger scheme than the ones on which he reported.
articles.abstract: The government now contends that a whistle-blower within Cell Therapeutics was the mastermind of a much bigger scheme than the ones on which he reported.
articles.lead_paragraph: Whistle-blowers are typically celebrated for risking their careers, and even their safety, to bring corporate wrongdoing to light.

articles.headline: A Battle Over Venture Capital for Small Businesses
articles.snippet: A bill that aims to help small businesses is being criticized by some who say it allows venture capital companies to pose as small firms to tap into billions of federal research dollars.
articles.abstract: A bill that aims to help small businesses is being criticized by some who say it allows venture capital companies to pose as small firms to tap into billions of federal research dollars.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 24  Representative Jason Altmire, a Pennsylvania Democrat, says he was just trying to help the small technology companies blossoming in his district, just north of Pittsburgh.
